skills.name: Solve problems involving working out the duration between two given times
Solve problems involving adding a period of time on to a given start time
Solve problems involving subtracting a period of time from a given end time
Solve problems using information in timetables

explanations.A: Almost. 3 hours would mean Phil was back after 6:47, but he was back earlier than this.
explanations.B: 3:47 to 5:47 is two hours. It is then 13 minutes until 6pm, and another 12 minutes to 6:12pm. That is 2 hours + 12 minutes + 12 minutes = 2 hours 25 minutes
explanations.C: Almost, just check that you have counted on from 47 to 60 minutes, and then from the hour to 12 minutes past
explanations.D: Almost. 3 hours would mean Phil was back after 6:47, but he was back earlier than this.

explanations.A: Almost. 4 hours would mean Jack was back after 11:39, but he was back earlier than this.
explanations.B: Almost. 4 hours would mean Jack was back after 11:39, but he was back earlier than this.
explanations.C: Almost, just check that you counted on from 39 minutes past to the hour, and then on to 24 minutes past.
explanations.D: 7:39 to 10:39 is 3 hours. then it is 21 minutes to 11:00, and other 24 minutes to 11:24. That is 3 hours + 21 minutes + 24 minutes = 3 hours 45 minutes

explanations.B: Not quite. 5 hours would take us up to 8:47, and we still have to add on the minutes
explanations.C: Not quite. 5 hours would take us up to 8:47, and we still have to add on the minutes
explanations.D: 3:47 + 5 hours = 8:47. If we add on 13 minutes that would get us to 9:00, and we have another 30 minutes left to add on which gets us to 9:30

explanations.A: 5:36 + 3 hours = 8:36. Then if we add on 24 minutes we get to 9:00 and we have another 20 minutes to add on which gets us to 9:20
explanations.B: Not quite. 3 hours would take us up to 8:36, and we still have to add on the minutes
explanations.C: Not quite. 3 hours would take us up to 8:36, and we still have to add on the minutes

explanations.A: Taking off 2 hours 38 is the same as taking off 3 hours and adding on 22 minutes. 8:05 - 3 hours = 5:05. We then add on 22 minutes to get to 5:27
explanations.B: Almost. Taking off 2 hours would get us back to 6:05, but you have taken off less than 2 hours as your answer is later.
explanations.D: Almost. Taking off 2 hours would get us back to 6:05, but you have taken off less than 2 hours as your answer is later.

explanations.B: Almost. Taking off 4 hours would get us back to 5:03, but you have taken off less than 4 hours as your answer is later.
explanations.C: Taking off 4 hours 51 is the same as taking off 5 hours and adding 9 minutes back on. 9:03 - 5 hours = 4:03. 4:03 + 9 minutes is 4:12
explanations.D: Almost. Taking off 4 hours would get us back to 5:03, but you have taken off less than 4 hours as your answer is later.

explanations.A: Almost. Just make sure that when you add on the 30 minutes this takes you up to 9pm.
explanations.B: Not quite. This would be true if she arrived at 10pm, but she doesn't arrive home until 10am the next day
explanations.C: 30 minutes would take us to 9pm. 3 hours would take us to midnight, and then a further 10 hours would take us to 10am. 30 minutes + 3 hours + 10 hours = 13 hours 30 minutes
explanations.D: Not quite, this would take her to 10pm the next night

explanations.A: 30 minutes would take us to 9am. 3 hours would take us to midday, and a further 11 hours would take us to 11pm. 30 minutes + 3 hours + 11 hours = 14 hours 30 minutes
explanations.B: Not quite, this would take us to 11am.
explanations.C: Almost. Just make sure that when you add on the 30 minutes this takes you up to 9am.
explanations.D: Not quite. Make sure that when you add on the 30 minutes this takes you up to 9am, and then go all the way through to 11pm not 11am.

explanations.A: This is the time if the train was 18 minutes early. We need to add 18 minutes onto the time
explanations.B: Almost, this is only 8 minutes late. Don't forget the other 10 minutes
explanations.C: This is the time the 1510 train would arrive in Warwick parkway if it was 18 minutes late. Be careful to look at the correct row and column
explanations.D: It should arrive at 16:57, but we need to add on another 18 minutes. 16:57 + 3 minutes = 17:00. We have another 15 minutes to add which is 17:15

explanations.A: Not quite, This is if the train is 17 minutes late. It is 17 minutes early so we need to take this off of the time
explanations.B: It should arrive at 15:06, but we have to subtract 17 minutes. If we take off 6 minutes that will get us to 15:00, we still have another 11 minutes to take off which is 14:49
explanations.C: Not quite, I think you were trying to find the time if it was 17 minutes late. It is 17 minutes early so we need to take this off of the time
explanations.D: Almost, just be careful of your minutes
